subject: Career
title: Hustle Culture: The Productivity Trap
description: A 60-second lesson on Hustle Culture: The Productivity Trap.

hook.text: 'Rise and grind.' 'Sleep when you're dead.' Hustle culture turned exhaustion into a badge of honor.

buildup.text: The hustle narrative promises: if you work hard enough, long enough, you'll succeed. Rest is for the weak.

discovery.text: Research shows productivity drops sharply after 50 hours per week. After 55 hours, it's nearly zero per extra hour.

twist.text: Hustle culture benefits employers, not employees. It normalizes overwork and makes boundaries feel like laziness.

climax.text: Sustainable performance comes from intensity during work hours plus genuine recovery. Not from more hours.

punchline.text: Working more hours doesn't mean more output. After 55, you're just performing.

quiz.question: At how many weekly hours does productivity drop to nearly zero per extra hour?
